heading: Objective
body: Use a short, purposeful dealership tour to increase comfort, credibility, and trust—introducing key people and touchpoints that reinforce how we support the guest before, during, and after the sale.

heading: Core Idea
body: A great tour is not about the building—it’s proof of support. It reduces anxiety and increases confidence before numbers.
bullets: Purpose first|Service proof moment|1–3 intros|Clean transition
notes: Use as the module anchor framework.

heading: 2.0 The Science
body: Guests feel uncertainty and lack of control in unfamiliar environments. Familiarity and proof reduce threat and increase trust.

heading: Familiarity Reduces Anxiety
body: Seeing where things happen (service, support, amenities) turns unknown into known and increases comfort.

heading: Credibility Through Proof
body: A real service touchpoint and real introductions act as social proof and credibility, stronger than promises.

heading: Support Story
body: Guests buy long-term support, not just a vehicle. The tour reframes the dealership as a partner.
bullets: Who helps you|What it looks like|How scheduling works

heading: Peak-End
body: A reassuring moment plus a clear ending creates a positive anchor before numbers.
bullets: One proof moment|Clear next step|Calm tone

heading: 3–6 Minute Tour
body: Keep it short and purposeful; long tours feel like stalling.

heading: Purpose First
body: Always explain why you’re touring: support + comfort + ownership clarity.
bullets: This will take 3 minutes|I want you to see support

heading: Service Proof Moment
body: Include one quick service credibility moment as the core trust anchor.

heading: Introductions with Value
body: Only introduce people who increase confidence; limit to 1–3.

heading: Clean Transition Back
body: End the tour with the next step, making numbers feel natural.
bullets: Now let’s look at numbers clearly|Service tone

heading: Tour Permission Line
body: Ask permission and set timing to reduce pressure.
bullets: 3 minutes|Can I show you something quick?

heading: Service Credibility Line
body: Connect service touchpoint to guest support and ease.
bullets: This is where you’ll check in|We keep it simple

heading: Advisor Introduction
body: Short intro that frames relationship and support.
bullets: This is who helps you once you own it

heading: Role-Play Focus
body: Practice tour permission, service proof moment, intro, and clean transition—especially with rushed or anxious guests.

heading: Worksheet Purpose
body: Reinforce a short tour plan: purpose line, 4 stops, service credibility sentence, and transition to numbers.
